title: SHAP dependence plot issue
body:
**Input:**
`
shap.dependence_plot(ind = ('Feature1', 'Feature2'),\
    shap_values = shap_values_trees_xgb,\
    features = X_test,\
    feature_names = X_test.columns.tolist())
`

**Error**

IndexError
Traceback (most recent call last)
~/Desktop/New_main.py in 
      4684     shap_values = shap_values_trees_xgb,\
      4685     features = X_test,\
----> 4686     feature_names = X_test.columns.tolist())

/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/plots/_scatter.py in dependence_legacy(ind, shap_values, features, feature_names, display_features, interaction_index, color, axis_color, cmap, dot_size, x_jitter, alpha, title, xmin, xmax, ax, show)
    564         "'shap_values' must have the same number of columns as 'features'!"
    565 
--> 566     # get both the raw and display feature values
    567     oinds = np.arange(shap_values.shape[0]) # we randomize the ordering so plotting overlaps are not related to data ordering
    568     np.random.shuffle(oinds)

IndexError: only integers, slices (`:`), ellipsis (`...`), numpy.newaxis (`None`) and integer or boolean arrays are valid indices
`


**Tried**
- random forest and XGB both not working
- only specifying one feature works
